title: How to block or detect infrared heat sensor cameras - Quora

response.answer_text: detect is difficult as it is a passive infrared sensor so there is no indication of it other than seeing the camera. blocking depends on the sensitivity of the camera, my one will detect a rabbit at 150 ft. The one on a police helicopter can detect a human under thick undergrowth/trees or through the wooden wall of a shed. you might block it if you covered yourself in a blanket soaked in ice cold water or were under water in a swimming pool. If you could find a large heat source that was much hotter than your body, something like the hot air outlet of a large air conditioning plant, it might work.

Chill or heat whatever you want to ”block” to the Ambient Temperature of the room and everything will appear ”black” on thermal. Detection is more difficult since they have made them smaller and smaller, they even have a ”circuit board sized” one to be installed in a ”spy camera”. So they can be literally hidden in an air vent or any appliance. So if your idea is to rob your employer who may use heat-detecting security cameras, odds are the loss prevention booth will have you on ”tape” doing it.
